programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Frank tries to reinstate an officer he previously fired after questioning the circumstances surrounding her firing; Danny and Baez investigate the murder of a college basketball player linked to sports betting; Jamie and Eddie pick a wedding venue.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: A medium claims to know what happened to a woman who was found dead of an apparent suicide; Jamie and Eddie help a woman who bought cheap insulin online that nearly killed her son; Frank goes after a man he thinks is laundering money from a charity.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny goes against a direct order during a hostage negotiation; Nicky asks Erin for help when her friend is in jeopardy of losing his scholarship because of a crime he didn't commit; Frank helps a distraught officer who accidentally shot a girl.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: While off duty, Danny encounters a gas station robbery in progress and is forced to use his weapon, leaving him shaken and his family and co-workers concerned; Frank learns that a top officer in his department has a dark past.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: After a woman is murdered in her apartment, Danny and Baez turn to her daughter for help, but instead she complicates the investigation; someone from Jamie and Eddie's past launches a smear campaign against them.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Frank's longtime friend Lenny reveals that an upcoming exposé will air some of the NYPD's dirty laundry; Erin must decide how to charge a doctor whose experimental treatments led to the death of his terminally ill daughter.

programme.title: Movin' On
programme.desc: Sonny and Will rescue bus passengers and an injured driver after a blowout and get pinned down by a sniper.

programme.title: Movin' On
programme.desc: Will and Sonny borrow money from a loan shark to purchase two truckloads of peaches to sell in Canada.

programme.title: Movin' On
programme.desc: An armed convict commandeers the truck.

programme.title: Movin' On
programme.desc: Will falls in love with a truck-driving widow who offers a hauling job that pays more than it should.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Baitfish murders a person close to the team in order to send a message to Pride; a citywide hunt for the elusive criminal takes place.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride has suspicions about a mole; new intelligence comes to light that indicates a breach at the ports.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride and the team must go on a dangerous undercover mission to retrieve a stolen missile and prevent an attack.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A blogger dedicated to exposing government corruption is murdered; during the investigation, it is revealed that a war crime may have occurred during a humanitarian effort in Bolivia.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: When a highly regarded Navy pilot is killed after crashing a new, high-tech jet at an air show, the team must determine if it was human or mechanical error.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: When a man opens fire on a patrol car and wounds Roman, Burgess pursues the shooter; with no gun found at the scene, Burgess faces the accusation of shooting an unarmed man; the man who sent Voight to prison is assigned to help defend Burgess.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Lindsay and Halstead discover the youngest daughter is the only survivor of a shooting at a family home; Antonio and Olinsky investigate a pyramid scheme self-help group; Platt tries to convince Crowley that Burgess and Roman should remain partners.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: When the body of a single mother is found in the trunk of her car, the team is shocked to learn the victim had contact with Voight's reformed son.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Tasked with shadowing a crisis prevention team, Upton finds her approach to policing at odds with the team's mental health clinician; Voight stands by Upton as she continues to struggle in her personal life.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Ruzek gets mixed up in a case after a late-night poker game is raided; afraid of becoming like his father, Ruzek struggles to stand down and allow Intelligence to carry out the investigation while he remains on leave.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Burgess works an extra shift at the 13th District and gets caught in the middle of a drive-by attack on refugees; the team works together to track down the shooter and uncover the true motive behind the attack.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Atwater turns to an unlikely source of support when a string of jewelry store robberies shakes his confidence.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Intelligence teams up with ASA Chapman to take on an abduction case involving a teenager; the case hits close to home for Voight, leading him to take a personal interest in finding justice for the victim.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: An ongoing case hits close to home for Voight as Intelligence teams up with an SVU detective to track down a prolific offender.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Upton brings SVU detective Petrovic back into the fold to help with the investigation of a tender-age kidnapping.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Upton becomes consumed with a decades-old missing persons case linked to Petrovic after a young child shows up to the district seeking help.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: As Atwater finds himself distracted by a past case, a CI from his past resurfaces with a tip on a string of armed robberies that are raising concerns.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: The victim of a murder-arson case is discovered to have been wearing a CPD issued wire at the time of his death; Burgess meets her new partner; Cmdr. Crowley questions Lindsay about the night intelligence pursued Justin's killer.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Voight and the team search for answers after discovering a man badly beaten and learning that his fiancee is missing; Lindsay asks Halsted a surprising question; Platt is berated by Fogel for going over his head.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: After Platt is physically assaulted while getting into her car, she's rushed to Chicago Med, where Mouch finds himself being questioned; Antonio and the team look for previous threats against Platt.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: Ian, the owner of the small popular local beach bar Tropical Heat, and a close personal friend of Nick's, convinces Nick to help a pretty woman with amnesia who he just met. The more they find out about her past, the less she wants to remember.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: Nick Slaughter, a disgraced former Canadian Mountie, and DEA Agent moves to the tropical island paradise of Key Mariah. Once there he starts his own Private Detective Agency, and meets Sylvie Gerard, a local travel agent. Together they form a strong friendship and quite the detective team. However, the local police squad never make it easy for them luckily they have plenty of friends to help along the way. The Town of Key Mariah will never be the same again thanks to Nick Slaughter and company!

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A strange woman hires Nick to stop her husband, who she believes is trying to murder her. However, Nick's investigation reveals evidence that leads him to believe she might be more psychotic than paranoid.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: Nick's partner from his DEA days arrives in Key Mariah, with a small time criminal who can help bring down a drug lord who has recently opened his operations in Key Mariah. Complicating matters is Nick's old boss has arrived in Key Mariah & for some reason keeps trying to shut down the investigation.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: Nick reconnects with Maria his old flame from High School. As the two rekindle their relationship it comes out that she is the mistress to a visiting mafia boss. Making matters worse, is the fact mob bosses wife is jealous, and wants her dead!

programme.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large
programme.desc: Phil builds his human-sized tinfoil boat wrong several times before he figures it out; Phil gets into a tub full of the main ingredient in diapers.

programme.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large
programme.desc: Phil adds more ingredients in the classic baking soda and vinegar volcano experiment.

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: Alligators mouth is filled with 80 teeth and can chomp down with 2000 pounds of force. Plus mountain goats unique hoofs help navigate worlds roughest terrain. And dogs can be 100 thousand times more sensitive to odors than humans which can save lives!

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: There are 37 species of fox. Why does the fennec look like Yoda? Harbor seals are found washed up on shore - the reason for their injuries will astound you. Plus, the age old question – do sharks really need to swim continuously in order to stay alive?

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: We head to a winter wonderland in Banff, Alberta, Canada. Philippe joins the avalanche safety team at Ski Lake Louise as they show a few different ways of avalanche control including dynamite blasts on the mountain. We then head to the Fairmont Chateau Lake Louise for a snowshoeing expedition. And finally we look at the dynamics of ice while climbing a frozen waterfall.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: We look at different examples of cultural science. Starting off in Hawaii, Philippe paddles out on a 6-man canoe during a lesson in early Hawaiian navigation. Then it's off to Florida to join members of the Seminole tribe who show us different uses of plants as tools and food in the harsh terrain of the everglades. We wrap things up in the Pacific Northwest looking at the Suquamish tribe.

programme.title: A Snow White Christmas
programme.desc: With the help of seven quirky friends, Blanca Snow must use the power of true love to overcome her evil stepmother from ruining Christmas.

programme.title: A Beauty & the Beast Christmas
programme.desc: Ginger Holiday, a peppy Christmas influencer, is convinced by her agent to fake a holiday romance with viral bad boy Beau Bradley to gain more followers.

programme.title: A Royal Christmas Engagement
programme.desc: A hardworking ad executive starts to fall for a consultant she has been paired with to land a big account, unaware that he is a prince in disguise.

programme.title: A Prince & Pauper Christmas
programme.desc: When her confidential informant in a criminal investigation goes missing, a young federal agent hires his look-alike, a prince, to play his role.

programme.title: A Christmas Witness
programme.desc: Federal agent Jessie babysits Dean McCoy until he testifies before a grand jury a few days after Christmas. As the two try to save a small town's holiday lighting ceremony and fight off hit men at the same time, they form a romantic connection.

programme.title: 60 Days In
programme.desc: Lockdowns result following a violent fight in the women's pod and an abuse of power in pod 600, proving that the luck of the draw with cellmates directly influences the jail experience.

programme.title: 60 Days In
programme.desc: The participants face difficult obstacles and must make risky alliances as they struggle to survive life on the inside.

programme.title: 60 Days In
programme.desc: A flood in the Fulton County Jail's South Annex, escalating problems with cellmates, and respect issues push the participants to the brink of despair.

programme.title: The First 48
programme.desc: When a young Dallas father is gunned down in front of his home, a police detective discovers that the victim had a secret that may have led to his murder.

programme.title: Accused: Guilty or Innocent?
programme.desc: When a mother is found fighting for her life at the bottom of the stairs of her home, suspicion falls on her firefighter husband; the prosecution alleges she was the victim of a devastating assault.

programme.title: Accused: Guilty or Innocent?
programme.desc: A community is shocked when a man kills his partner of decades, but he claims that he was insane at the time, whereas the prosecution says he was rational.

programme.title: Accused: Guilty or Innocent?
programme.desc: A fight between teenagers turns deadly when an 18-year-old is killed by a single gunshot to the chest, and while eyewitnesses claim a 16-year-old student pulled the trigger, he insists he is innocent.

programme.title: Accused: Guilty or Innocent?
programme.desc: A tattoo artist is shot in his home and the case goes cold for two years until two informants step forward and identify a young photojournalist, but the accused insists he has an alibi and was miles away at the time of the shooting.

programme.title: Accused: Guilty or Innocent?
programme.desc: A young man stabs another man who assaulted his brother and attempted to steal from their family-run gas station.

programme.title: Accused: Guilty or Innocent?
programme.desc: A traveling nurse is pulled over for a traffic violation in New Mexico and is arrested for felony burglary that she carried out in her home state of Ohio.

programme.title: Accused: Guilty or Innocent?
programme.desc: When a landlord shoots a problem tenant dead in Florida, police and prosecutors act swiftly and charge him with murder; the landlord claims that the tenant was carrying a machete at the time of the shooting and threatened to kill him.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: From the ancient Babylonians to modern-day urban explorers, mankind has always been fascinated by abandoned places; discovering the allure that draws people to post-apocalyptic landscapes.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: All over the world are forbidden "triangles" that are mysterious regions where ships, planes and people enter and then just disappear; they are found in Bermuda, Alaska, Japan and elsewhere.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: More than 80% of the Earth's oceans remain unexplored, and in many ways, the underwater world is the final frontier; as new technology allows people to explore oceans and deep lakes more than ever before, nobody knows what they will find.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: King Arthur, England's first pop culture superhero; his exploits inspired blockbuster movies and television series like "Middle Earth", "Harry Potter", "Game of Thrones" and "Star Wars"; the significant impact of Arthurian legend on Western culture.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: People on every continent have claimed to see Bigfoot's footprints. And ancient myths and legends speak of an ape-like giant stalking the earth. What if, as Ancient Astronaut theorists believe, there is evidence to connect Bigfoot with an alien species?

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Thirteen crystal skulls which are believed to hold a mystical power whose secrets will be revealed when the skulls come together to form a global grid.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Mysterious relics and sealed vaults may have been hidden on purpose and protected by an extraterrestrial source.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The U.S. military denies that the 1947 Roswell crash involved anything other than a weather balloon, but theorists claim that other UFO crashes were reported all over the world at the same time as the crash and that the wreckages were retrieved.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Erich von Däniken's "Chariots of the Gods?" suggests that aliens visited Earth in the distant past, and there are those who believe that he will be proven right.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Researchers ask if Cloud computing represents the rediscovery of an ancient repository of knowledge known as the Akashic Record; neuroscientist Dr. Dario Nardi measures the brainwaves of Dr. Deepak Chopra as he enters a state of deep meditation.

programme.desc: Researchers ask if Cloud computing represents the rediscovery of an ancient repository of knowledge known as the Akashic Record; neuroscientist Dr. Dario Nardi measures the brainwaves of Dr. Deepak Chopra as he enters a state of deep meditation.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: During World War Two, the Nazis stole vast amounts of art, gold, silver and currency, and stashed it across Europe; while some of the plunder has been recovered, much more is still missing nearly 80 years later.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: After a series of dark and ominous events, an unassuming family home on Long Island becomes the most notorious house in America; 50 years later, it's spawned a title wave of books, documentaries, and films.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: A series of unexplained deaths near Chicago in 1982 starts a nationwide panic; the victims are connected by one frightening detail: cyanide-tainted capsules of Extra-Strength Tylenol; 40 years later, it remains an active FBI investigation.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: In 1969, a serial killer taunts investigators with cryptic ciphers, leaving police and the public questioning his identity for over 50 years; new evidence and technology may finally be able to crack his code and discover who the Zodiac Killer is.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: In 1587, a group of settlers land off the coast of North Carolina on Roanoke Island to establish the first English Colony in America; a few years later, the 115 men, women and children vanish without a trace, leaving only cryptic clues.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: Despite centuries of sightings and searches, one deep-sea monster remains unidentified; as evidence continues to mount, the mystery endures as to whether the Loch Ness monster exists.

programme.title: Crime 360
programme.desc: In a suburban neighborhood of Cleveland, gunshots ring out in the middle of the night, and a young male is found dead on the front porch of his own house.

programme.title: Crime 360
programme.desc: In Little Rock, Detective Chuck Ray is called to a scene where one man has been shot in the hand while another man lies dying outside of his apartment with a gunshot wound.

programme.title: Crime 360
programme.desc: A young woman is found shot to death in a ransacked apartment. Detectives speculate she may have stumbled upon a robbery. They interview the apartment's residents.

programme.title: Killer Cases
programme.desc: When a hairstylist failed to pick up her children for a planned celebration, she was reported missing by her ex-husband; investigators discovered a bloody scene at the salon, but the hairstylist and her SUV were gone.

programme.title: Killer Cases
programme.desc: Makeva Jenkins, a successful businesswoman and mother of three, boasted on Facebook that she had grown her business to six figures; hours later, she is shot dead with a bullet to the head.

programme.title: Killer Cases
programme.desc: Jazz trumpet player Scott Sessions fails to show up for a gig; his body is found a few days later, wrapped in plastic, partially burned and hidden in a forest; investigators trace his last known whereabouts to the residence of his new love interest.

programme.title: Killer Cases
programme.desc: Todd Kendhammer calls 911 in a panic, describing a freak accident involving his wife; police are suspicious of Todd's responses in the interrogation room; forensic details from the autopsy report cast further doubt on his story.

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: In this episode we'll examine the life cycle of a butterfly and delve into the mechanics of how a bird is able to take flight. Plus, the mystery of how a Venus Flytrap catches its prey is revealed.

programme.title: Xploration: Animal Science
programme.desc: In this episode, we find out how the Jaguar's spots create a disruptive pattern that makes them harder for prey to see. We'll also learn how a bee sting really works, and how a salmon is able to migrate thousands of miles to spawn.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: This week we will be looking at a fascinating subject that most of us take for granted. To do so, I'll be hiking through forests, kayaking on lakes, and even venturing through scientific laboratories, all to explore the Amazing World of Plants.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: Our planet is a land of extremes, from raging forest fires, to frigid fields of ice. Join Philippe Cousteau as we explore nature's power of Fire and Ice, here on Awesome Planet.

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: In this episode, we examine the science of the cat. We'll learn about the evolution of cats throughout the world, featuring the Saber-tooth Tiger. Find out how cat senses stack up against other animals. Also, how will you do on our feline pop quiz?

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: Prairie dogs have their own language and one of the most complex communications in the animal kingdom. Plus an owls hearing can pick up a heartbeat over 100 feet away. And leaf cutter ants slice through foliage with jaws that vibrate 1000 times/second!

programme.desc: Jefferson Graham takes us on a photowalk through Oregon Coast.

programme.title: Photowalks On Scripps News
programme.desc: Jefferson Graham tours Santa Fe, New Mexico and shows us how to capture the best photos of the city's beautiful landmarks with your phone.

programme.title: Hindsight
programme.desc: A survivor reflects on The Station nightclub fire on February 20, 2003 in West Warwick, Rhode Island. 100 people died and more than 200 were injured. The fire was sparked by pyrotechnics that went off during metal band, Great White's performance.

programme.title: Hindsight
programme.desc: On June 24, 2021, the Champlain Towers South, a beachfront condominium in the Miami suburb of Surfside, Florida partially collapsed, killing 98 people. Family members of victims and a WPTV anchor reflect on the tragedy.

programme.title: In Real Life

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: Two ex-marines join forces for one sole nefarious purpose - to abduct women and keep them a sex slaves; carrying out their operation with military precision, unafraid to kill innocent civilians along the way.

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: The disappearance of a decorated military man stumps law enforcement and shocks a central Texas community, but once investigators dig into his home life, they uncover a vicious murder plot involving his veterinarian wife.

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: A drug abuser out on a joy ride kidnaps then kills an innocent coed in Oregon; investigators spend months attempting to solve what they believe is a missing person's until the perpetrator strikes again 1400 miles away.

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: A serial killer with a history of serial rape terrorizes Tampa, Florida's red light district, targeting women of night at random, getting away with murder for months, only to be brought to justice by the one victim he let go.

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: A well-respected real estate agent becomes the prime suspect in his wife's murder; the investigation reveals a scandalous private life and a murder-for-hire scheme involving a mentally handicapped handyman.

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: A former army medic devises a sick plan to kidnap women, impregnate them and keep them in his basement as part of a personal baby farm.

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: The murder of a millionaire doctor's wife sets off a massive manhunt throughout New England; law enforcement quickly locates the suspected killer only to find out he has a history of not only violence but also cross-dressing.

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: An unemployed teen mom and her new husband concoct a plan to kill an innocent man they meet on Craigslist, resulting in a vicious stabbing that sends shock waves through a small Pennsylvania community.

programme.title: Someone They Knew With Tamron Hall
programme.desc: Lita McClinton thinks the man at her door is just delivering a dozen pink roses, but the delivery guy delivers death instead; the decades-long hunt for justice spans multiple continents before reaching a dramatic conclusion in an Atlanta courtroom.

programme.title: Someone They Knew With Tamron Hall
programme.desc: When the body of 22-year-old Misty Morse is found floating in the Indian River, police suspect one of her many boyfriends; with only a piece of nautical rope and a strip of duct tape to go on, an unusual kind of DNA could actually break the case.

programme.title: Someone They Knew With Tamron Hall
programme.desc: Small-town plumber John Cataneo fixes other people's homes for a living, until death came knocking on his front door; to find out who wanted him dead, police investigate the contents of Cataneo's own home, and get the leak they need.

programme.desc: The client asks for a last-minute engine swap on the '50 Ford F5 COE build.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: Bill and the team fix another shop's botched lift on a 2017 Ford F-350.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: A '65 Ford Falcon Club Wagon is transformed into a custom family cruiser.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: A 1973 El Camino is transformed into the Ride of the Future.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A 1937 International Harvester gets a big old Cummins 12-valve diesel engine that's as heavy as the truck itself; a 2005 Chevy Colorado gets a new lease on life as a nitrous-infused drag truck.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: A 1996 dump truck is the largest truck the shop has ever customized; the guys go extra heavy duty to create a military-styled megatruck; a lowrider enthusiast wants a custom air ride and LS swap for his pristine 1934 Buick.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: This year's over-the-top build has Bill and crew lifting a 2020 Chevy Silverado 5500 more than a foot with a custom heavy-duty air suspension; the guys also prove their Texas mettle by radically overhauling the utility bed.

programme.title: Texas Metal's Loud and Lifted
programme.desc: HOF running back Earl Campbell arrives with the parts of a 1949 Cadillac,

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: NFL Hall-of-Famer Earl Campbell made a career mowing down defenders, so the guys take the same hell-bent approach to rebuilding his 1949 Cadillac; they also customize a van for a disabled motocross rider so he can drive again.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The team revamps an old school '34 Buick into a modern day lowrider; after months of rebuilding the body and making a custom frame for Earl Campbell's '49 Cadillac, the Hall of Famer challenges the shop with a last-minute wrinkle.

programme.title: FRIDAY NIGHT POKER
programme.desc: "Watch a replay of the sixth Friday Night Poker cash game! Kelly Minkin, Bryan Piccioli, Marle Cordeiro, Lilou Agostini, Frank Kassela, and Justin Young headline an spooky $5/$10 cash game. Jeff Platt, Brent Hanks, and Amanda Leatherman call the action, with a guest appearance from Daniel Negreanu!"

programme.title: FRIDAY NIGHT POKER
programme.desc: "Watch a replay of the seventh Friday Night Poker cash game! Chris Moorman, Dan Shak, Randall Emmett, Jon Turner, Hish Salama, Frank Kassela, and Marle Cordeiro a high-flying $5/$10 cash game. Jeff Platt, Brent Hanks, and Amanda Leatherman call the action!"

programme.title: FRIDAY NIGHT POKER
programme.desc: "Watch a replay of the seventh Friday Night Poker cash game! Phil Hellmuth, Jennifer Tilly, Rob Iler, Mark Birnbaum, Jay Farber, Frank Kassela, and Maggio Cipriani in an exciting $5/$10 cash game. Jeff Platt, Brent Hanks, and Amanda Leatherman call the action!"

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The Event #3: $10,000 Pot-Limit Omaha final table is set at the 2022 Poker Masters! Ronald Keijzer is the chip leader ahead of Alex Livingston, Allan Le, Damjan Radanov, Dan Shak, and Ben Lamb, as the final six players play for the $202,500 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The star-studded final table of the $1,500 Stud would see WSOP bracelet winners Men Nguyen, Ted Forrest, and Minh Nguyen looking to add more WSOP gold to their trophy case. Chad Brown would be eyeing his first WSOP bracelet as $111,440 in first-place prize money was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Nearly 800 rebuys would take this field size to 1,334 and a prize pool of over $1.26 million. The final table would be stacked with tournament veterans led by Daniel Negreanu, John Juanda, Mike Matusow, Lee Markholt, Paul Phillips, and Ram Vaswani as all eyes were on the $365,900 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The 831-entrant field created a $1.14 million prize pool in the first $1,500 No-Limit Hold'em event of the 2004 WSOP. Poker author Blair Rodman, and tournament regulars Joe Awada, Scott Epstein, and Kent Washington held seats at the final table, along with "The Crew" member Scott Fischman as the $300,000 first-place prize was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The biggest No-Limit Hold'em buy-in of the 2004 WSOP outside of the Main Event would attract 254 entrants and create a prize pool of $1,193,800. Barry Greenstein and Dewey Tomko fell short of reaching the final table, as WSOP veterans James Sousa and Paul "Eskimo" Clark headlined the final table ahead of Lee Watkinson, Thomas Keller, Martin de Knijff, and Young Phan as they chased the $382,020 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The $1,000 Ladies Event attracted 201 entrants and would see the final table headlined by Karina Jett and Susie Isaacs as nine lucky ladies look to capture the WSOP bracelet and $58,530 first-place prize.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Louise starts to move in, Dan decides to sell the furniture he bought for Roseanne when they were married; he soon finds parting with the furniture harder than he thought.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene brings Nick to the hardware store, where they run into Ben, who invites Nick to join him at The Lunch Box to watch a Bears game.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners celebrate Mark when he makes Dean's List at his new magnet school; Jackie continues to navigate her relationship with Neville.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene continues to navigate her breakup with Ben; Dan offers to talk with Aldo's dad when he doesn't approve of Harris and Aldo's relationship.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark returns to public school and finds it hard to fit in; Darlene isn't happy when she finds out what Mark's doing to make extra cash for college.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene loves the house she's looking at, but when the realtor says she has a chance of getting the house if she's part of a couple, she convinces Ben to pretend to be her partner.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The family is locked down in their home due to a shooting incident in the neighborhood.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Becky outs her relationship with Professor Davis, it's his erratic behavior that sends Becky down a path to reevaluate their relationship.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene searches for a home that she and Becky can afford; after an attempt to boost business at The Lunch Box goes awry.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan enlists a few friends to help him with the funeral home remodel; Robin and Darlene take a big career risk.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene struggles to cope with the stress of construction; Lou returns as Mark's contrabassoon teacher.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Ben and Darlene are excited to share their good news with the family, but Neville and Jackie, and Aldo and Harris, share their own very similar news.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners gear up for a megawedding; Jackie & Neville, Darlene & Ben, Harris & Aldo are planning for a big day, but discover that some of the couples may not be on the same page.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: In an effort to save money, Darlene and Ben, and Jackie and Neville head off on their joint honeymoon, where their cost-saving measures contribute to a tension-filled getaway.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Jackie moves in with Neville, he shows up to their home with an excess of animals from his vet office; Darlene and Ben argue Darlene is turning into her father.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark is anxious to get his driver's license; Darlene attempts to teach Mark to drive, but her frantic energy sends him running to Ben for help; Harris meets a new guy online.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When a relative passes away unexpectedly, the family must debate about who should gain custody of a jaded nephew, who is just shy of his 18th birthday.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Problems arise on Beverly Rose's first day of kindergarten; Becky and Darlene have a disagreement.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris takes a stand on an issue that ruffles a few feathers in Darlene's new neighborhood.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene receives a promotion, but she quickly learns the fancy title is not all it's cracked up to be; when Louise loses her job at Casita Bonita, an opportunity arises.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie must come to terms with her mother becoming ill; Darlene's job hunt proves to be more difficult than anticipated.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene, Ben, Becky and Beverly Rose move into the new house, where Darlene implements a new set of rules.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan meets his in-laws for the first time when Louise's family comes to visit; Darlene helps Becky with a parenting problem.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The death of a beloved teacher from Dan and Jackie's high school brings old classmates together.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene and Ben get into a fight and ignore Becky's boundaries in the house; Dan accuses Jackie of losing all of their home videos.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene has issues with Dan's plumbing work in her new house; Jackie tries to find a caregiver for Bev.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene continues her search for a new job; Becky is desperate to spend more time with Beverly Rose.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris makes a big announcement; Ben is overwhelmed with family responsibilities.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris takes her anger out on Darlene; Dan and Louise spend an entire day in bed together.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark fights for a spot in the Lanford High chamber orchestra; Jackie puts a lottery machine in the Lunch Box.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan and Jackie take a road trip to a hardware wholesaler in Oklahoma; Darlene heads out of town and leaves behind a plethora of to-do notes for Becky and Ben.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Louise gets into a feud with Becky after accidentally sending a rude message in the family text thread.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene figures out a plan to afford Mark's college tuition; Jackie and Louise try to help Becky meet a guy.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Neville confronts Jackie about loaning Dan money; Darlene attempts to play matchmaker for Mark.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Mark's graduation approaches, he considers his relationship with his father; Louise plans a big graduation ceremony at the Lunch Box.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A sudden turn of events forces the Conners to face their daily struggles in a way they never have before.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene is in for one surprise after another when David introduces his girlfriend, Blue (Juliette Lewis), and mentions that Mark and Harris will be spending the weekend with them.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Halloween, the favorite time of year for the Conners, but an email from the school banning certain costumes, including Mark's, sets off an argument between Dan and Darlene.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Geena learns D.J. hasn't been taking Mary to church while she's been away, so she insists they go as a family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A family member drops a life-changing announcement; Dan suspects that Becky isn't sticking to her end of the deal about her drinking; Darlene continues her job search.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: With Mark and Mary's help, Jackie convinces Dan to build a chicken coop so the family can eat organic eggs.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan questions Peter's motives when he learns about the pricey Christmas gift Jackie bought for her new unemployed beau. Elsewhere, Mark and Mary write up their Christmas wish list.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Becky helps Harris keep a secret from Darlene, it causes a split between the two sisters.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Dan gets injured on the job covering D.J.'s vending machine route, the choice to sue the company could lead to D.J. getting fired.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Ben offers Mark free piano lessons, Darlene finds this as an opportunity to test his parenting skills. Meanwhile, Jackie throws Becky a baby shower.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Darlene grapples with a life-altering offer, a conversation with David turns her world more upside-down.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: After Emilio's deportation, Jackie takes on a paternal role crafting a birth plan for Becky; Darlene navigates a love triangle with David and Ben; Harris faces her own dilemma.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene struggles to decide between David and Ben; Becky begins to doubt herself as a mom; Mark gets in trouble at school when a picture of him and his boyfriend kissing goes viral

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris confronts Darlene's lifestyle; Jackie meddles in others' affairs to evade her own issues; Becky struggles with the expenses of parenthood, her family lends support.

programme.desc: Becky applies for a bartending job at Casita Bonita; Dan is concerned it could worsen her drinking.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: At Halloween, Jackie learns a shocking secret while trying to reopen the Lunch Box.

programme.desc: Jackie and Becky pitch their business plan to Darlene in hopes of getting the Lunch Box back, but Darlene's decision leads to hostility among the three.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Thanksgiving chaos erupts as Dan gathers the family; tensions rise over the Lunch Box; Harris surprises everyone with a bold move.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie’s faced with a tough decision that brings the family and community together.

programme.desc: Dan is disappointed when everyone but Becky forgets about his birthday; Darlene faces another issue; Dan excludes Jackie from the family Christmas Santa photo for mistreating Louis

programme.desc: The Conners resist Becky's Packers fan boyfriend; Dan emphasizes family loyalty to the Bears to Mark; Ben and Darlene seek a loan for their magazine.

programme.desc: Darlene’s thrilled when Harris gets into Central Illinois State, but she may have other plans.

programme.desc: The Conners debate voting reasons; Louise's offer threatens to take her from Lanford, prompting family intervention in Dan's relationship.

programme.desc: Dan avoids grief until it confronts him; Ben and Darlene tackle baby fever; Dwight's nervous to fill in for an injured chef.

programme.desc: Dan connects with his half-brother but struggles with their father's unequal treatment; Jackie hits it off with a fun married couple.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene joins Price Warehouse for income; Jackie advances her relationship with Ron and Janelle; Ben alters his appearance for advertisers.

programme.desc: Harris returns home newly-unemployed; Becky seeks childcare; Jackie advises reaching out to Emilio's family; the family ponders tattoos.

programme.desc: Dan’s ready to share his feelings with Louise; Darlene realizes how badly she wants a baby.

programme.desc: Dan and Louise deepen their bond amid the challenges of aging; Darlene's night in jail leaves Ben in charge of parenting; Mark's class experiment with a friend results in hickeys.

programme.title: Christmas Coupon
programme.desc: An ice skating instructor reunites with her high school sweetheart, now a professional hockey player, when he signs his niece up for skating lessons.

programme.title: Christmas Cupcakes
programme.desc: With their family bakery facing foreclosure before the holidays, two rival sisters must put their differences aside to win a TV baking competition.

programme.title: Christmas Coupon
programme.desc: An ice skating instructor reunites with her high school sweetheart, now a professional hockey player, when he signs his niece up for skating lessons.

programme.title: A Miracle on Christmas Lake
programme.desc: After suffering the loss of his best friend Charlie on Christmas Eve, sixteen year old Bobby Whiteside ventures out onto the lake where they played countless games of winter hockey. Upon shoveling the ice surface he makes a shocking discovery --- a magic, perfectly groomed hockey rink that appears only at night and only in his presence. When a local construction company purchases the land for development, Bobby must join forces with his high school crush, rally the town, and play one last game on the night pond --- with an old friend.

programme.title: Saving Santaland
programme.desc: Sparks fly between a famous model and a farmer with a young daughter when she visits her childhood home for the holidays.

programme.title: The Eff Yule Log
programme.desc: Holiday wishes from the team.

programme.title: A Frosty Affair
programme.desc: An unexpected road trip during a blizzard with a stranger to make her wedding forces a small-town teacher to take a hard look at her life choices.

programme.title: A Very English Christmas
programme.desc: A woman coordinates her half-sister's Christmas Eve whirlwind wedding in the English countryside with the help of a handsome market owner.

programme.title: A Bell Family Christmas
programme.desc: Secrets come to light as the Bell family celebrates Christmas in their new home in this story of family, friendship, faith, and forgiveness.

programme.title: Headed South for Christmas
programme.desc: An angst-ridden teen longs to meet the mother who died during her birth, as her dad takes her to spend Christmas with relatives they barely know.

programme.title: A Bulldog for Christmas
programme.desc: On Christmas vacation, a cynical college student is magically transformed into a bulldog until she learns the meaning of her family and the Christmas spirit.

programme.title: The Christmas Bunny
programme.desc: A foster child’s lonely heart is restored along with the injured bunny she found on Christmas Eve when a kind woman’s healing power saves the holiday.

programme.title: An Oddsville Christmas
programme.desc: A young girl must track down her two unusual friends, before the wacky, but well-meaning duo cause hilarious Christmas-related chaos.

programme.title: A New Husband for Christmas
programme.desc: Stan and Kelly marriage seems to have run its course and, with the holidays approaching, Kelly’s one Christmas wish is to find a replacement spouse.

programme.title: The Gift of Grace
programme.desc: Everything a devoted husband and father of two young girls has worked for hangs in the balance when he gives in to the advances of a new coworker.

programme.title: Headed South for Christmas
programme.desc: An angst-ridden teen longs to meet the mother who died during her birth, as her dad takes her to spend Christmas with relatives they barely know.

programme.title: Uninvited for the Holidays
programme.desc: In a modern family Christmas comedy, a fish-out-of water story meets "Home Alone."

programme.title: Gift Wrapped
programme.desc: A dying man’s wish and a series of unfortunate events will teach three families that life’s greatest gifts don’t come gift wrapped.

programme.title: A Raunchy Christmas Story
programme.desc: Friends throw a secluded holiday bash to put romance back into a friend's life, unaware that an investigative reporter and a Russian spy are guests.

programme.title: Christmas on the Slopes
programme.desc: A celebrity chef finds inspiration—and her perfect partner—in the heart of a mountain resort and in the arms of its handsome but hotheaded head chef.

programme.title: Anything but Christmas

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: The Awards. This programme presented by Richard Hammond encompasses all of the best action of the series.

programme.title: Wipeout Canada
programme.desc: Donut run, ball swing. Sweeper: Dangly balls. Dizzy Dummy: barrel crossing and log roll

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Ordinary British folk fly halfway across the world to test their endurance and bouncability in Argentina.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s no doubt that the ‘Ball Crusher’ Sweeper is the star of tonight’s show. With a brother- sister team hanging by a thread and a three-way hurdle, this week’s Sweeper writes itself into the History books. Tonight is also the night we meet Buffman, a pint sized Superhero with a twitch and a photo finish at the Dizzy Dummy threatens extinction to a Rare Breed. A week of action packed Wipeouts with Latin Dancing lotharios, what more can you ask for? And for the kids, a Fairy Tale, Wipeout Style!

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This time the 'Dodgeball Men' are back to make 'The Qualifier' game an even bigger challenge for contestants.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Wipeout Australia debunks the myth that only young, fit and funky people should go on game shows. This week we are forced to take notice of Demolition Dave, a 49 yr old South Australia man who thanks to some home training smashes the qualifier. For those lucky enough to survive the Fly Screen Sweeper it was Dizzy Dummy time. Emerging as the Dark Horse, Kobie Mulligan earned herself a shot in the Wipeout Zone, joined by a Strategist and Rubber Woman resulting in a bitter showdown.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Twenty foolhardy Brits attempt to conquer the purpose-built obstacle course in Argentina.

programme.title: Wipeout Canada

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: This week contestants on Wipeout Australia are bought undone by a seemingly simple obstacle on the Qualifier, the Slippery Stairs. It’s all in the name really, an innocent set of stairs, covered in Wipeout Crash cream. Its up the way and down the way for all and sundry. The lucky 12 that move through, battle it out with a giant toothbrush Sweeper. ‘Nat with the Tats’ and Renee ‘Lets get physical’ move through to the Dreadmill, flying the banner for the ladies. Look out for Scotty Six Toes at the Big Balls and get the ear plugs ready as you meet Herr Chris. It’s a colourful week with leotards, laughs and lots of ladies.

Will it be poached & roasted chicken with new season onions, wild rabbit and leek turnover with piccalilli, or rabbit pudding with parched peas and gravy?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: For the fish course, which dish is going to be king: turbot with brown shrimps and spring vegetables, wild sea bass with shrimp toastie, or bream with hazelnuts and salted caramel?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the fish course. Will the winning dish be Gloucester Old Spot pork with smoked venison, salt marsh lamb with sweetbreads, or oak roast middle white pork with broad beans?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Marcus Wareing chooses his favourite from the three dishes: caramel parfait with honey ice-cream, rhubarb and custard tart with beetroot ice-cream, and strawberries with meringue and mint water ice. For one of the chefs, this is the end of the road.

Will it be a wild rabbit with ham hock, carrots, asparagus and morels; wild rabbit with a baby leaf salad, black pudding, crispy quail's egg, broad beans and a shot of real ale; or warm pork and apple pie with chilled tomato soup, Yorkshire cheeses and homemade pickle?

programme.desc: The chefs pull out all the stops with their fish dishes: line-caught North Sea mackerel with gooseberries; pickled shellfish and wood smoked crispy prawns with the `smell of the sea'; and smoked trout soup with beetroot, cucumber and oyster nuggets.

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.desc: Chefs from Wales - Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Aled Williams - pull out all the stops with their fish dishes: poached lobster with confit potatoes, sea bass with brown crab, and sea trout with apple, beetroot and smoked mussels.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the main course and rabbit, rose veal and venison are all dished up for `Great British Menu' veteran Richard Corrigan. Plus, one of the chefs is joined by `Eastenders' star June Brown for a fundraising challenge.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the dessert course. Will a strawberry and coconut dessert, a frozen white chocolate dish or apple and cherries come out on top? `Great British Menu' veteran judge Richard Corrigan will decide who goes through to the judges tomorrow.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is decision time for the chefs from London and the South East. One chef left the competition last time and only two remain. They will cook their entire menus for the `Great British Menu' judges, Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. This time they will be joined by celebrity guest judge, comedienne and writer Arabella Weir.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is finals week and 24 of the nation's finest chefs have been whittled down to just eight. Over the course of four hour-long shows, they will battle it out in the kitchen for the chance to get a dish to the Comic Relief Banquet. Actress Patricia Hodge, one of the stars of sitcom `Miranda', joins judges Prue Leith, Oliver Peyton and Matthew Fort to taste all eight winning regional starter courses.

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Shaq's Garage

Biggie D, Fleming, and Tibbs race out to find out what happened with the missing truck. Quickly they discover the evil Keeter Reebus is behind it and they have to locate the missing shipment before time runs out / Klaus tells Shaq that he needs maintenance to get out of volunteering on the first day of the Boys and Girls Club Rolling Wood Derby so he can race Niccolo Tessio. After winning, he thinks he's in the clear and can make the derby the next day. When Niccolo challenges him to yet another race, Klaus has to decided what's more important: beating Niccolo or fulfilling his promise to Shaq.

programme.title: Shaq's Garage
programme.desc: During "Clean Up Orlanta Week", the Paq volunteers to clean up trash in the park much to Himari's displeasure. After filling up Queenie's loader, everyone heads to the dump a storm bursts overhead. When lighting strikes the trash, it unleashes a monster that leaves Himari alone to defeat / Prince Jaffa arrives in Orlanta from Kinshasa, Africa for an official visit and stays at Shaq’s house. Despite strict orders by Prince Jaffa's chaperone to not leave the garage after a long day of Princely duties, Himari convinces Prince Jaffa to sneak out with her and Fleming to experience what it's like being a normal teenager.

programme.title: My Dream Farm

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Two gardeners, each living on their own, are hoping Monty can help them. In Blackpool, Alex dreams of turning her boring back yard into a magical enchanted forest. Also in Bristol, Ross has taken on a very over-grown allotment.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Leyton, Tariq and Sairah want to turn their dumping ground of a back yard into a sumptuous award-winning garden, suitable for entertaining friends and family. Both have competitive jobs in the banking sector and are used to winning at work but when it comes to gardening, they don't know where to begin.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: One couple battle to turn a clay-clogged building site in Sussex into a piece of Portugal. Another tackle a forest of overgrowth in their new back garden in Cadeby. They are determined to create a productive space, something they have always wanted.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is busy planting umbellifers and making some changes to the dry garden. He also sows peas and pots on his dahlias. Carol reveals exciting plans for an ambitious show garden she's designing for the RHS Hampton Court Palace Garden Festival.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam visits a walled garden in Somerset to meet a group of volunteers who are gardening alongside those who need help to transform their lives. At Longmeadow, Monty creates two different planting schemes for pots for shady spaces, transplants grasses in the jewel garden, and plants out his favourite varieties of tomatoes.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Gardeners' World

programme.desc: Monty is busy planting out tropical gingers and sweetcorn and direct sowing beans. Joe Swift visits a stunning walled garden in Denbighshire, and Rekha Mistry shares the secrets of growing aubergines.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Join Mark Peterson as he ventures into Croatia’s wild heart, hot on the trail of a legendary stag. programme.title: AFTCO Original Film
programme.desc: Last August, we partnered with Capt. Moe Newman of Journey South Outfitters to host the AFTCO Women’s Fish Camp in Venice, LA. Nine female ambassadors from various states joined to test our spring women's fishing line, representing both saltwater and freshwater perspectives. The experience shaped the final offerings for this spring and future line plans for our women's fishing clothing.

programme.title: Storytellers

programme.title: Storytellers

programme.title: Storytellers

programme.desc: Rifle season is off to a slow start but things are heating up with lots of tags to fill.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: With bow camp starting off strong at the Dirty Bird, Randy is feeling good about the rest of the week. Until Cody decides to head into town and places a small wager with a stranger.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy, Cody, and Big Rig are still in Oklahoma with a long list of work to get done before fall comes. From moving blinds around to filling feeders the work never ends.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: With two weeks until the opener of Missouri archery season, Randy and Cody are trying to do everything they can to have the Raven prepped for the first bow camp.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: The boys are still at the Dirty bird in Oklahoma, trying to get a few more tasks done before heading back to the Raven in Missouri. They also manage to get out and do a little velvet scouting with the Hawk spotting scope.

programme.title: The Raven Project - "Raven Whitetails"
programme.desc: Catch all of the deer that have hit the dirt over the last few seasons on The Raven right here.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy and Cody are back on the Raven in Missouri and with opening day of bow season fast approaching they are scrambling to get all the final prep work done and correct any mistakes they might have made along the way.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Bow season is finally here and the boys are at the Dirty Bird in Oklahoma. Randy is chasing a buck he named "The Camp Buck" because of how close the buck is to camp. If Randy can get it done this will be his biggest buck to date in Oklahoma.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy and Cody are wrapping things up on the Raven before bow season arrives in Missouri. Planting I-70 the plot where Randy killed one of his biggest Missouri bucks ever last year. Then Randy and Cody attempt to setup a new farm they are calling “The River Farm” they attempt to plant a food plot, bush hog, spray the plot, setup a new Titan blind, and setup a Hooyman dual perimeter fence all in one day before the sun goes down.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Back at the Raven for bow camp and everything is coming together. Randy has a close encounter with one of the OG bucks on the property while Nate closes the deal on a big five year old.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We love our college chapters. Hudson has been a long time member of TTHA as well as serving with the Texas A&M Chapter. We have a great time at G2 in pursuit of Axis deer.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: In 2010, Amberly Snyder’s life changed forever when an accident left her paralyzed from the waist-down. Her comeback story not unlike something you’d see in a movie…in fact it inspired one. Disabled Outdoorsmen USA contacted TTHA and set up this hunt and we were fortunate enough to be able to capture just some of Amberly’s story and her harvest of a beautiful Axis buck at the G2 Ranch in the spring of 2022.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Denise Sanchez was awarded a hunt at G2 following our Hunters Extravaganza drawings. Its great to get to spend time on the ranch with new members of TTHA. Denise gets familiar with a giant and learns about new technology while on this hunt.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: The bond between and parent and child can grow in many ways, but nothing compares to the bond shared when hunting. The annual Father-Son hunt at FE Hill Outfitters has becoming a tradition for Heath and his son Gavin and in 2021, Gavin was able to take his largest buck to date, with his dad Heath behind the camera.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We find ourselves fishing with Troy from Lonestar Beer. Not only is Troy a great friend he is also a big supporter of Hunters Extravaganza. We get to catch up in the offseason and spend a day on the water discussing future events and reflect on what all Texas has to offer.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: WE join Bobby Falkenberg as he joins Bret Ferguson from Double T Outfitters. Bobby is an avid outdoorsman, judge, and father of 5. Bret manages 30,000 acres in Ozona TX, the knowledge he has of every inch of this amazing low fence ranch is remarkable. Bobby has an action packed 2 day hunt.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: The hunt for the Hayblower buck is finally over. A cold front in Georgia had the deer on their feet and Tyler Jordan was able to take full advantage with his bow on Realtree Farms.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Realtree's crew of waterfowl hunters get together for their annual Louisiana duck hunt. Dr. Duck, Billy Campbell, Rusty Creasey, and Michael Pitts head down south to get on the ducks. There's a lot of ducks around, but they're playing hard to get. So, the guys have to get creative to make it happen.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: With record low temperatures in the forecast, the Black Cloud crew hits the timber for one last hunt before the freeze. Some days hunting ducks in the Timber is all about your calling and decoy spread... some days you're on the X and none of that matters.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: The Road Trips crew gets one more hunt in before the rain arrives in Georgia. Michael Pitts finally has the right wind to head back into the honey hole. Colton Jordan hunts with his father Bill hoping to lay eyes on a buck they spotted earlier in the year. Tyler Jordan decides to hang and hunt a new spot where a big 9-pointer is showing up.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Tyler Jordan and the Under Taker are hunting cranes down South. Check in to see how the hunt went. It was certainly a waterfowl hunt to remember.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Public competition, little sleep, mother nature, and a wrong turn. It's a rough weekend for the Arkansas opener but Dr. Duck and Billy Campbell wouldn't be anywhere else. It's the Super Bowl of Duck Hunting and everyone is ready to hit the timber.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: The Realtree team meets up with Ole Miss friends Keith Carter and Ken Crain, as well as Mr. Doug from Pivotal Partners, for a Merriam's and Rio turkey hunt in northern Nebraska. The action is fast and furious. Day No. 1 brought three gobblers for team Carter/Crain. On day No. 2, the action stayed consistent and team Carter/Crain killed two more. Then, Brian Doughman from Realtree knocked down No. 6. It was another incredible hunt in the Keya Paha river valley.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Dr. Duck and Billy Campbell head north to the Dakotas to get a jump on the 2019 duck season with Ed McDonough and friends. Stale weather and too much water make field hunting a bust, but a cold front and a pothole covered in birds quickly changes the tempo and helps the crew ring in the new season in style.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: It's Rifle Season in Oklahoma. Kyle Barefield and wife, Stevie Barefield are hunting the rut for big western bucks with the brand new X-Bolt 2 Rifle from Browning. A front blows in, and with the change in weather, 2 big whitetails go down.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Duck hunting in Louisiana is as much about its history as it is about its future. In the season's final days, Jean-Paul learns about Louisiana’s rich waterfowling history, dives into conservation projects throughout the state, and returns to Bayou Black for one last ride. Shoot straight and come hungry because it's the last hunt of the season.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: The Duck Camp Dinners crew is back in the bayous as Jean-Paul wraps up his last hung of the season before his son is born. Jean-Paul shares a duck recipe handed down by his father, they forage for wild mushrooms, get into swarms of blue wing teal and celebrate the season with fire.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: After a late night of good times, venison chili, and some old school roux the crew heads out for another day of hunting ducks. Adaptability is critical, and after a couple of quick adjustments the team finds themselves back in the ducks.

programme.title: Be Real
programme.desc: Rusty Creasey knows a thing or two about duck hunting. He manages the legendary Coca-Cola Woods property in McCrory, Arkansas, has his own line of Echo Duck calls and has placed in the World’s Championship Duck Calling Contest time and again. Further, his skills and expertise have been showcased on many duck hunting shows and podcasts. Yet despite his success as a professional duck hunter, Creasey says managing the Coca-Cola Woods is what he loves most. Known for offering some of the best green timber duck hunting in the Mid-South, the Coca-Cola property was originally bought by the family who owned the Coca-Cola bottling company and turned into a duck club in 1937. Creasey stresses the importance of thanking folks who’ve had a positive impact in your life. “Whoever took you and got you started in the outdoors, if they are still around, thank them,” he says. “Thank them while you still can. My uncle got sick with cancer. I told my mama I want to thank him for everything he did. Little league games. Fishing. And I had that opportunity. I wrote him a birthday card and told him how much he meant to me. He told me that was the best birthday present he ever got. A month later, he lost his battle with cancer, but I had that closure and was able to thank him.” He says since 2002, he’s made a point to thank everyone who has meant anything to him. “My daddy,” he says. “Lost him in 2018. Last thing I told him was I loved him. Thanked him. He was my hero. If I leave you with anything, do this for me. Thank whoever it is. Be it your mama, your daddy, your uncle or your grandpa. Hug their neck, and thank them for all they’ve done for you. Without them planting that seed in us, we wouldn’t be who we are today.”

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Anyone can be a cowboy—that’s the biggest thing the DIRT crew learned in Texas. From riding bulls in Fort Worth to off-roading in the Chihuahuan desert to forging their own path across this vast state with the help of local trailblazers Liz and Lou Lambert. Lucky for us, they even stopped by Huckberry’s own backyard in Austin for a quick ruck and a couple games of chicken sh*t bingo. When the dust finally settled, we fired up the barbecue for our beefiest feast yet and raised our ranch waters high to 10 DIRT episodes in the can.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his family’s traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, he’ll meet plenty of farmers and foragers—harvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: Baitfuel Fishing Tournament
programme.desc: Day 2 of the BaitFuel Fishing Tour Championship out of Gananoque, Ontario on the St. Lawrence River

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: Tyler and Sara take the show on the road for the first ice outing of the year. They head to Lake of the Woods at Tamarack Island Wilderness Lodge!

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike heads to Crystal river to chase Redfish in his new Cayo Skiff.

programme.title: FinQuest Outdoors
programme.desc: In the premiere of FinQuest, freshwater pro Ryan Miller dives into the world of saltwater fishing in Florida. Guided by Alex Burgess, Ryan tackles sailfish and tuna while mastering kite fishing. The adventure continues with his family as they enjoy a thrilling hydrofoil ride in Jupiter, Florida, blending fishing excitement with family fun on the water.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: It's May of 2022 and Mark Peterson is waterfowl hunting in Argentina. A year has passed since Mark conquered the North America Waterfowl Slam. During the off-season, and with Covid just a memory, his focus shifted to thoughts of South America and the waterfowl species that it holds. After a few months of research and talking with the experts at Worldwide Trophy Adventures, he laid out the plan to attempt the South America slam in 2022. With 20 species on the list, Mark is now hunting ducks below the equator as they migrate North to warmer weather. Enjoy this first installment of a 9 episode series that showcases his new quest for another single-season waterfowl slam.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson closes out the half way point on the South America Waterfowl Slam. On just the third day of the hunt, he is able to take a Chilean Wigeon and a Rosy Billed Pochard which make species number 9 and 10 of the 20 on his list. Mark is still sharing the blind with Matt Gindorff, a WTA consultant, and they discuss waterfowl hunting in Argentina and how it compares to that of the U.S.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is duck hunting for the 4th day in Argentina and finds that luck is on his side. He and Matt head to a blind for an early morning hunt in hopes of getting a Black Headed Duck before they disappear for the day in the reeds. He also still needs a Red Shoveler, but things take a quick turn while he is walking through the marsh, about to call it a day. Enjoy this episode of The Journey Within

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson continues his quest on the Hearst Ranch in California. Next up on the list, California Aoudad. These Aoudad were introduced to the ranch in the early 1920s and have thrived ever since.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark finally closes in on the Brazilian Teal in Argentina. This is the last of the 13 species that he had planned to target while hunting in Argentina for the South America Waterfowl Slam, but it didn't come easy. To find this last one, he and the crew must travel farther North to warmer weather and ultimately find themselves wrapping up this leg of the journey.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: It took a couple days longer than expected, but Mark Peterson finally gets species number 14, the Knob-Billed duck while hunting in Peru. After a couple of close calls, this one was the definition of adapt and overcome. Mark and the crew had to first find the birds, then learn what it was going to take to get into the right position in order to capitalize. Of course, there was some fast mid-day action along the way to keep spirits high.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: This week Mark continues his hunt in Australia on Marble Island. After a successful first day, the group heads out the next morning in search of a Sambar stag. After closing the distance Mark isn’t able to get a steady rest so they move in closer while the Sambar stag is on the move.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson finishes the South America Waterfowl Slam in the Andes at 15,000 feet elevation. With only 2 days left, he is able to capitalize on every opportunity and take the remaining 6 species needed on the list of 20. It's been an incredible journey, and it all comes down to this!

programme.title: Primos

programme.title: Primos
programme.desc: It’s non-stop and up-close big bull action as Team Primos kicks off the 2020 season with an early September hunt in New Mexico. The entire team is in camp and on-point to chase some big bugling bulls. Brad Farris drew the long straw this fall and waste no time heading up the mountain with Will Primos dropping back and firing up the Hyper lip double, Hoochie mama and the bullet bugle elk calls.

programme.title: Primos
programme.desc: Jordan “Big Country” Blissett gets in the driver’s seat for some up-close action—and we do mean UP CLOSE! Brad needs plenty of help packing his bull off the mountain, and Lake is down to a precious few days to hunt before heading off for Arizona.

programme.title: Primos
programme.desc: It’s T-Roy’s turn to get on the board in New Mexico, but Team Primos runs into an all-day affair with a stubborn bull in his own bedroom. How long will this old boy test Troy’s patience as he waits behind his Mathews bow with Will, Jordan and Slade standing by.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade takes you on a ride through one of the coolest cities in the south, the historic Natchez, Mississippi. This is an area in which Slade sells a lot of hunting land and being only 40 minutes from where he grew up, Slade is very familiar with all there is to do in the area not only from a recreational standpoint but also for entertainment. Slade takes you through the showing process on a beautiful piece of property and bring it full circle at the closing. You’ll also watch a deer hunt with Slade in Natchez that was featured on Realtree Monster Bucks DVD. This is a jampacked episode with so much to learn and also enjoy. We know you’ll love it.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade gives you the grand tour of his home property. Slade’s dream was the same as many others, have a place where he can build a home, raise a family, and also have plenty of room to enjoy the outdoors and chase big rack bucks. Slade gives you a breakdown of how he took his raw tract of land and turned it into a beautiful homestead and outdoor paradise. If you are interested in how you can achieve your dream of raising a family on a dream property, this is the episode for you.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade takes us through his new investment property, and breaks downwhat’s involved in taking a raw land tract and creating extremely desirable turn-keyhunting properties.Caleb and Slade double up on some Wilkinson County gobblers for Calebs first turkeykill ever.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and part of the old Trained Assassins Crew, Luke Mitchell (producer) and Ryan Wascom (host), head out to Colorado to chase bugling elk with their bows. Also joining the crew is one of Slade’s real estate clients and his son. Part of the deal when this client worked with Slade was that Slade lined them up an elk hunt the following fall. It is an amazing week at camp with five arrows being sent down range and multiple elk hitting the dirt. You do not want to miss this one.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, we are super busy juggling the turkey season opener, but we also have our real estate convention in Gulf Shores Alabama, multiple listing videos to complete, and property showings. It happens every year to us, spring kicks off and people want to have properties of their own knowing dog gone well it’s the most wonderful time of the year. TURKEY SEASON! It’s a jam up of a week. You’re not going to want to miss it.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, we are smacking turkeys and making mid-term investments. 1031 Tax money is the number one way to build your land portfolio and create a place for your family to enjoy. Follow along as we turn a old beat up piece of dirt and turn it into the ultimate place ground for a hunter such as myself. From habitat to harvest we have been on fire.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Watch as Lori tags her first turkey of the season as well as the daily grind and comments from the office in McComb, Mississippi. The ladies in the office isn’t too fond of turkey season until it’s their turn.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and the new producer (Tim Guidroz) go out on their first turkey hunt together, and even though the weather is not ideal, they get the job done on a Wilkinson County gobbler. programme.title: The Cast

Mike teaches the guys about the local waters including pogey boats and most importantly, world class red fish.

programme.title: The Cast

Even though fishing is tough the guys build strong friendships and lasting memories.
