programme.title: Scripps News Investigates
programme.desc: A joint investigation with ProPublica reveals troubling complaints against one of this nation's largest auto lenders; A look at increasing attacks against US servicemembers in the Middle East and the invisible wounds that linger for many after coming home; And investigative reporter Phil Williams confronts neo-Nazis on the streets of Nashville.

programme.title: Scripps News Investigates
programme.desc: A months-long investigation into members of the national guard being denied medical care for injuries sustained in the line of duty; a look at the surprisingly high number of bridge strikes happening in the US and why so many bridges weren't built to sustain a direct hit; And we explore the booming online market for counterfeit diet drugs.

programme.title: Free Spirit
programme.desc: Master bartender Kate Gerwin visits Kansas City to talk whiskey, taste the nonalcoholic future at an innovative new bar, experience jazz at the Mutual Musicians Foundation, and learn all about Prohibition in the city that ignored it best.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: From a coffeeshop chain to snowy railroad tracks, these unconventional crime scenes bring the childhood game of Cops & Robbers to life.

programme.title: FIXT
programme.desc: David suffered from a blood disorder and hasn’t had a full set of teeth since he was 12. Heather struggles with a rare genetic condition that put her in dentures in her 20s. Can the FIXT team write the final chapter in their health journeys?

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A man vanishes from a boarding house in 1988. The fight to find him uncovers one of the most shocking cases in Sacramento history and the surprising revelation of a grandmotherly-looking serial killer hiding in plain sight.

programme.title: Free Spirit
programme.desc: Birmingham’s favorite bartenders take Kate on a world tour of cocktails with tropical tiki showstoppers, aromatic Middle Eastern flavors, blue-collar dive bar favorites, and Kate’s first and truest love – agave spirits.

programme.title: FIXT
programme.desc: A horrific accident doomed Allison to a lifetime of pain and failed surgeries. In search of a brighter smile, Mar-cia’s seen half a dozen dentists, but remains unsatisfied. Can FIXT tech meet the needs of their deserving clients?

programme.title: FIXT: Veteran Faces Terrifying Decision
programme.desc: Andrew returned home from serving his country with a toothache so bad he covers his mouth out of habit. Mickey had forgotten how to smile after years of struggle with addiction and abuse. Will the FIXT team help them smile again?

programme.title: Lost Innocence: The Tragedy of Harmony Montgomery
programme.desc: A police investigation into a missing seven-year-old girl in Manchester, New Hampshire reveals harrowing details that shock the state. But even more disturbing is the discovery that the tragic outcome could have been avoided.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: One vacation. Two teens. Thousands of text messages. What sounds like the beginnings of a typical modern romance turns to tragedy–and controversy–for a coastal Massachusetts town.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: Six people are slain in a home in a quiet Iowa town. One person survives a gunshot to the head and claims to have no memory of the incident. The tragedy and eventual trial shred the social fabric of the neighborhood.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Dr. Treva Brown holds a PhD in Chemistry, works for the US Naval Research Laboratory and is a pageant queen. This workaholic PhDiva can’t make time for herself! Kinga wants to take Treva off the runway and into the outdoors.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: The brutal murders of two trans women of color just 48 hours apart in New Orleans unsettle the community, leaving many wondering if the cases are connected. Detectives uncover clues, yet justice remains elusive.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: After eight members of one family were killed in their homes in a single night, residents of the devastated Ohio community were left to wonder if they were next.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: In a serene community, a beloved doctor is bludgeoned in her own home. Investigators uncover a conspiracy that rocks the close-knit neighborhood to its core​​.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.desc: Ed and Day get competitive over a round of golf and learn a new twist on old fashion cocktail making before heading to Apis Meadery in Carnegie.

programme.title: Local Love
programme.desc: Austin is a bay area native who has never been in committed relationship. He’s in luck, as three Sacramento single guys vie for his affection taking him go kart racing, horseback riding and axe throwing.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: You can feel the love on this week’s culinary showdown. Chef Amy Mehrtens, Executive Chef of Copper Vine, challenges long-time friend Chef Daren Porretto, Chef de Cuisine at Saint John. While these two go back years, when it comes to competition they’re pulling no punches.

programme.title: Lost Innocence: The Tragedy of Harmony Montgomery
programme.desc: A police investigation into a missing seven-year-old girl in Manchester, New Hampshire reveals harrowing details that shock the state. But even more disturbing is the discovery that the tragic outcome could have been avoided.

programme.title: Stitch

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Recent college grad Trina Pham was raised in Greenville, SC, and loves her hometown. But now, it's time for this overachieving engineer to move beyond the city limits and get out into the world around her before embarking on her career.

programme.title: Hit Me With Your Best Spot
programme.desc: Local Kansas City notables, including Beth Wiese and Lucky Boys, give us the inside scoop on where to go for chocolate-covered bananas and how to prepare to order at Gates Bar-B-Q. Thinking about getting a tattoo? We've got a rec for that too!

programme.title: Completed Episodes
programme.desc: A show first! A woman and her boyfriend each try their hand at Frank Nicotero's trivia questions to see who can win the most money.

programme.title: Ballin' in Baltimore
programme.desc: Angel captures a different angle on Baltimore with activist and photojournalist, Devin Allen. They explore street photography, pop wheelies with a cutting-edge community dirt biking program and enjoy Charm City's most decadent treats.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: DJ Jenelle “J.Belle” Vannoy is living her dream of working in radio. She worked all over the country before landing in Albuquerque. As the voice of the city but new to the area, her desire to learn more about Duke City has Jenelle ready for adventure.

programme.title: FIXT
programme.desc: A horrific accident doomed Allison to a lifetime of pain and failed surgeries. In search of a brighter smile, Mar-cia’s seen half a dozen dentists, but remains unsatisfied. Can FIXT tech meet the needs of their deserving clients?

programme.title: Station Nightclub Fire
programme.desc: A survivor reflects on The Station nightclub fire on February 20, 2003 in West Warwick, Rhode Island. One hundred people died and more than 200 were injured. The fire was sparked by pyrotechnics that went off during metal band, Great White's performance. The episode looks at who did and didn't take responsibility for the fire and fire code safety measures that have changed since.

programme.title: Surfside Collapse
programme.desc: On June 24, 2021, the Champlain Towers South, a beachfront condominium in the Miami suburb of Surfside, Florida partially collapsed, killing 98 people. Family members of victims and a WPTV anchor reflect on the tragedy. The episode looks at changes in building codes and laws and research on saltwater corrosion.

programme.title: Partners In Evil
programme.desc: Two ex-marines join forces for one sole nefarious purpose – to abduct women and keep them as sex slaves. This evil duo carries out their "operation" with military precision, unafraid to kill innocent civilians along the way, until a petty crime unravels their sinister plans.

programme.title: The Venomous Veterinarian
programme.desc: The disappearance of a decorated military man stumps law enforcement and shocks a central Texas community. But once investigators dig into his home life, they uncover a vicious murder plot involving his veterinarian wife.

programme.title: In Search Of A Kill
programme.desc: A drug abuser out on a joy ride kidnaps, then kills, an innocent coed in Oregon. Investigators spend months attempting to solve what they believe is a missing person until the perpetrator strikes again 1400 miles away and provides law enforcement with a critical link to his criminal past.

programme.title: Terror On The Strip
programme.desc: A serial killer with a history of serial rape terrorizes Tampa, Florida's red light district, targeting women of the night at random. This killer gets away with murder for months, only to be brought to justice by the one victim he let go.

programme.title: Master Bob
programme.desc: A Michigan town is in disbelief after a well-respected real estate entrepreneur becomes the prime suspect in his wife's murder. The investigation into the homicide uncovers a sordid tale of double lives, sadomasochism and a callous murder-for-hire scheme involving a mentally handicapped handyman.

programme.title: The House Of Horrors
programme.desc: A former army medic devises a sick plan to kidnap women, impregnate them and keep them in his basement as part of a personal baby farm. When the plans turn to actions, two women lose their lives and four others experience the hell of a veritable house of horrors.

programme.title: A Wolf In Woman's Clothing
programme.desc: The murder of a millionaire doctor's wife sets off a massive manhunt throughout New England. Law enforcement quickly locates the suspected killer only to find out he has a history of not only violence, but also cross-dressing.

programme.title: Man's Best Friend
programme.desc: When the body of 22 year old Misty Morse is found floating in the Indian River, police suspect one of her many boyfriends. With only a piece of nautical rope and a strip of duct tape to go on, the devil really is in the details. But could an unusual kind of DNA actually break the case?

programme.title: And Murder Makes Three
programme.desc: Small-town plumber John Cataneo fixed other people's homes for a living, until death came knocking on his front door. To find out who wanted him dead, police have to see what needed fixing under Cataneo's own roof... and they don't like what they find.

programme.title: Scripps News Investigates
programme.desc: The Oscar-winning movie, Oppenheimer, told the Hollywood version of the first atomic bomb test. We explore the toxic legacy of that explosion in New Mexico nearly 80 years later. We also investigate the rise in robberies targeting US Postal Carriers and take viewers back to East Palestine, Ohio, just over a year after the derailment there.
